Andy Davis MySpace


In the wide world of American music, certain bands have a way of building an exciting life for themselves away from the glare of national attention. Much of that is because of the relationship the group has with its fans. It usually starts in small clubs or even backyards in their hometown, then spreads to nearby cities, neighboring states and soon across entire regions, until the band finally comes into its own as a national presence.

The Benjy Davis Project is poised to take on that presence. They've spent the past seven years building fan strongholds around the U.S., releasing three albums that capture their unique force. Davis's songs speak to the ability of music to move an audience, as seen in countless nights of touring and performing. There comes a point in a breakthrough band's career where they finally turn that corner into greatness. With the release November 4th on Rock Ridge Music of the Benjy Davis Project's album, "Dust," this Baton Rouge, Louisiana-based band now moves into that moment.

"I want to reach people and hopefully touch them in some way." That's how Benjy Davis describes his mission, and music is his medium. It's always been that way for him, since he was a young teenager in Louisiana, listening to everything on the radio, taking it all in until it would be his time to step up and become an artist. He formed the Benjy Davis Project in 2001, which began as a simple folk-rock duo but soon grew into one of the most popular bands in Baton Rouge. Eventually expanding into a six-piece group, the Project has recorded three albums prior to "Dust," each a big leap from the one before, and played across the country as headliners and support act on shows with John Mayer, Better Than Ezra, North Mississippi All-Stars and others, as well as events like the New Orleans Jazz & Heritage Festival. All this experience has brought them to that place where they can become the next band to take their Southern-based sound to a new level of national popularity.

Benjy Davis Project MySpace

title: See-I + The Pocket Band
body:
This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

Get 2 free Mp3's with all advance ticket purchases - 2 hot SEE-I songs exclusively for the fans!


BobbyT and the Magical Voyagers MySpace

 

The Pocket is a distinctly original band that combines alternative rock with authentic reggae roots. This combination creates an international sound for today's selective audience. Incredible vocals, memorable lyrics and an infectious stage energy always leaves listeners wanting more. For the last two years, The Pocket has been touring the US and the Caribbean. They have performed mainstage at the Air Jamaica Jazz and Blues Festival with icons Roberta Flack, Third World and Nora Jones. The Pocket also had the honor of showcasing at The Bob Marley 60th Anniversary Festival presented by Tuff Gong. During their Carribean tour, The Pocket lit up the Jamaican coastline performing at Western Consciousness while thousands of college spring breakers were also blown away by the party all night performances at Margaritaville, Negril.

The Pocket Band MySpace

title: The Guggenheim Grotto
body:
Tadhg Cooke's soul-inflected dark-folk has been described as "[crisscrossing] so many terrains that your musical compass may quiver with the sheer magnetic challenge" (The Irish Times). His "confident, impressive debut" album (HotPress) has been released both in Ireland and Japan. When he's not beating his solo drum, Tadhg also tours with David Geraghty's Meteor & Choice Award nominated solo project and has contributed guest vocals to Bell X1's Irish number one album, Flock. Cooke's second album, "Fingertips of the Silversmith" due for release later this year, features the cream of the Irish jazz, classical and experimental scene. In preparation for the release, Tadhg is hitting the shores of the US in June and July with a stripped down acoustic set.

Tadhg Cooke Website

title: Open Mic Showcase hosted by Ron Goad
Rachel Goodrich + The JeanMarie
body:
This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

 

Jackie Stem MySpace


The JeanMarie plays music for the masses. Hailing from Miami, a city whose whole appeal is wealth and exclusivity, the band may seem like a crew of outsiders with their grassroots desire for nothing more than a good time. The group relishes in their role as a pillar of the Miami independent music scene, by doing exactly the opposite of what is expected. They have cemented their image of a stranger in a strange place, literally and figuratively by adopting a polar bear as mascot. The polar bear does not belong in Miami and in many ways neither does the combination of sounds that comes from Jordan Davidson, Jason Haft, Curtis Nystrom, Jeffrey James and Geneva Harrison.

The JeanMarie's music is the sound of multi-tasking. Drawing on influences ranging from Steve Reich to Prince, they create an un-categorizeable cacophony that can only be referred to as "grungy guitar, squiggle synth, simmering cymbal-and-bass drum boogie music."

The JeanMarie released their first EP, What's a Revolution Without Backup Dancers?, to critical acclaim in 2006, and the self titled follow up EP in 2007. In January 2009 they will release Annie Jump Cannon, their highly anticipated full length album which has already brought them attention across the blogosphere and an article in the New York Times.

Chosen to open for national touring bands such as Bloc Party, The Noisettes, HelloGoodbye, and Tokyo Police Club, The JeanMarie aims to please. Unpretentious rock has never sounded so good. Join the revolution against the obvious, boring and fake but make sure you wear comfortable shoes, at The JeanMarie's party you'll be shaking it all night.

The JeanMarie MySpace

title: Local Matinee with Bloodlines + Kid Architect
body:
This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

 

Kid Architect was formed in late 2008 in Northern Virginia from the remnants of dismantled local bands whose members desperately sought to find a musical home full of musicians as dedicated and inspired as themselves. What resulted was the formation of an experimental rock band named Kid Architect with members Thomas Bridgwood (piano, guitars, and vocals), Tommy Alter (drums and percussion), Mike Douaire (lead guitar), and Clint Petty (bass). While the members of Kid Architect remain friendly, playful, and often goofy at heart, their music exhibits a sonic maturity and structure well beyond the short time they have existed.

For lack of a better term, the members of Kid Architect call their music a unique brand of experimental rock. Ranging from heavily distorted rock songs to the delicate intricacies of classical guitar licks, the members of Kid Architect are fluent in a diverse array of musical stylings.

This show will serve as Kid Architect's CD release Party for their newly recorded "PhilosoRaptor" EP. All attendees of the show will be given a free copy of "PhilosoRaptor" courtesy of the band.

Kid Architect MySpace

body:
This show will be seated.

Joey Ryan MySpace

Roy Jay MySpace

Jay Nash MySpace


"Gabe's voice is flawless, and it delivers some of the most well-crafted, heart-felt, kick ass songs I've heard in a long time. He and the band are truly gifted, and we're lucky they decided to share those gifts with the world." -Sara Bareilles

"With his latest album, and his debut for Fantasy Records (out August 26th) Dixon stakes his claim as the next great Pop Piano Man. Dixon will remind you of Elton when he still had hair and was making albums like Tumbleweed Connection and Madman Across the Water. That's high praise, and this is one of my favorite records of the year." -Paste

"From the timeless tone of his voice, to his mastery over melody and lyrics, Dixon embodies everything you would want out of the consummate pop artist. Gabe Dixon isn't like a classic pop songwriter, he is a classic pop songwriter. Dixon shows why he deserves to join the ranks of Jackson Browne and early Elton John in the pop pantheon. " -Nashville Tennessean

Gabe Dixon Band MySpace

title: Murphy's Kids + The Independent
body:
This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

Feed God Cabbage is a new face on the D.C. area music scene, but certainly not one to be overlooked. Although the band is still in its infancy, it has already gathered a steady fan base and played a handful of hard-hitting shows. Consisting of four members and 3-part vocals, this Reggae-Rock ensemble is reminiscent of the California Dub sound with an East Coast edginess that is sure to bring the crowd and rock the audience at any Friday or Saturday night gig.

Feed God Cabbage MySpace

 

Doesn't the world have enough "the" bands?

It does now.

First planted in the cranium of guitarist and singer/songwriter Dan Goldberger in 1989, The Independent grew into a full-grown band at the end of 2008. Taking a cup of pop, a spoonful of jazz, a drop of folk, and baking it in an oven of ROCK, The Independent concocts songs so infectious you might get a rash, in a style best-termed "pop-fusion". A sip of sonic experimentation and improvisation complements the sound nicely in the live environment, but never at the expense of putting a smile on your face and the songs in your heart. Apply liberally to the ears: The Independent is delicious AND fat-free.

The Independent MySpace

Earth Note Syndicate + Dreaming Of Eden
body:
LATE SHOW!

This show will be standing room only - with very limited seating.

Red Shift MySpace

 

To Speak Of Wolves MySpace

 

Dreaming of Eden is a hard melodic hard rock band based out of Northern Virginia who provides listeners with innovative, passionate songs that far exceed the boundaries of today's traditional hard rock stereotypes. They bring their stellar sound and jaw-dropping live show with a take-no-prisoners approach to achieving success and national exposure. Stemming from roots in the hardcore and emo scenes, Dreaming of Eden brings a fresh take to hard music. Driving riffs and distinct back beats layered with powerful vocal and lyrical content are what set Dreaming of Eden apart. In a world of screamers the quintet presents a new side to hard rock with noteworthy melodies while offering a high amount of energy.

Dreaming of Eden MySpace

title: Louis Fabrizi (CD Release Show) + The OK Corral
body:
EARLY SHOW!

The OK Corral began as a duo in August of 2007. A year after their conception, Brett and Mike have expanded their lineup to include Scott Nickley and Mike Burbrink. The band hopes to continue to gain exposure and play shows that engage listeners of all musical tastes.
Brett is a junior at the University of Mary Washington, Mike Matthews is a junior at Virginia Tech, Scott is a freshman at James Madison University, and Mike Burbrink is a Virginia Tech Alumni and currently a grad student at George Washington University.

Poor Man's Lobster is a droplet from the sun that rooted in the earth to represent the sounds absorbed and then reproduced into beings that heard the light within. The constant shifting of the earth's plates makes for a band driven to evolve into a magnificent swirl of sound that will captivate the listening ear. Dimensions have been crossed, wiring in the brain driven to succeed in genre bending openess that is the life blood that drives these beings to listen to eachother and the music in the world to bring a unique look into what is righteous music.
